intro: Octomeria geraensis, commonly known as the Geraensis octomeria, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its restricted habitat, Octomeria geraensis is considered a rare and endangered species.
